long: Meaning: used only in plural the "intestines", or (collectively) the "abdomen", figuratively, "sympathy"; by implication, a "vest"; by extension the "stomach", the "uterus" (or of men, the seat of generation), the "heart" (figuratively).  Usage: belly, bowels, Ã— heart, womb.  Source: from an unused root probably meaning to be soft;
